Class Board

java.lang.Object
  Board

public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

A facility for creating boards with specified number of cells.

Version:
1.00 2015-03-22, 1.01 2015-04-28
Author:
Syed Yousuf role #14

Constructor Summary
Board(int maxColumn, int maxRow)
          Creates a board with the default characteristics.
 
Method Summary
 Cell getCellSpecifed(int locationX, int locationY)
          Returns a specified cell.
 int getGeneration()
          Returns the value of the current generation.
 int getMaxColumn()
          Returns the maximum number of columns in the board.
 int getMaxRow()
          Returns the maximum number of rows in the board.
 void setSpecificIsDead(boolean isDead, int locationX, int locationY)
          Sets the specific cell to live or dead current.
 void testBoard()
          Tests the board and makes correct cells dead or alive.
 void updateBoard()
          Updates the board with the present state of each cell in the board in console-style.
 void updateCell()
          Updates each cell so that the future state of each cell becomes the present state of the cell.

Constructor Detail

Board

public Board(int maxColumn,
             int maxRow)
Creates a board with the default characteristics.

Parameters:
maxColumn - The maximum number of columns, must not be < 0
maxRow - The maximum number of rows, must not be < 0
Method Detail

getCellSpecifed

public Cell getCellSpecifed(int locationX,
                            int locationY)
Returns a specified cell.

Parameters:
locationX - The X-value of the cell, must not be > 0
locationY - The Y-value of the cell, must not be > 0
Returns:
The specified cell

Returns the value of the current generation.

getMaxRow

Returns the maximum number of rows in the board.

setSpecificIsDead

public void setSpecificIsDead(boolean isDead,
                              int locationX,
                              int locationY)
Sets the specific cell to live or dead current.

Parameters:
isDead - If the cell is dead or not.
locationX - The x location
locationY - The y location

testBoard

public void testBoard()
Tests the board and makes correct cells dead or alive.

updateBoard

public void updateBoard()
Updates the board with the present state of each cell in the board in console-style.

updateCell

public void updateCell()
Updates each cell so that the future state of each cell becomes the present state of the cell.
